DataElement.preferredName: Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Symptom Assessment Form Past Week How Much Difficulty Fever Greater Than 100 Degrees Fahrenheit Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how much difficulty they had during the past week with fever greater than 100 degrees Fahrenheit, using an 11 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Symptom Assessment Form Past Week Quantity Difficulty Fever Greater Than One Hundred Degree Fahrenheit Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire for monitoring the most debilitating symptoms experienced by patients with myeloproliferative neoplasms._The most recent week, including today._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved._Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than ninety-nine and less than one hundred-one and the quantity that it denotes._A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire for monitoring the most debilitating symptoms experienced by patients with myeloproliferative neoplasms.

Concepts.definition: A self-administered questionnaire for monitoring the most debilitating symptoms experienced by patients with myeloproliferative neoplasms.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Quantity Difficulty Fever Greater Than One Hundred Degree Fahrenheit Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.:Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A natural number greater than ninety-nine and less than one hundred-one and the quantity that it denotes.:A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than ninety-nine and less than one hundred-one and the quantity that it denotes.

A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: MPN-SAF: Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Symptom Assessment Form, Scherber R, et.al.,  2011
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for OHSU study in Rave per request by L.Bradley. mc 9/29/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._an ordered reference standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has not experienced a particular difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has not experienced a particular difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Occurring or done each day.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.: A subjective score of 1 on a Likert scale.
